intro: Lipochaeta elliptica, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Lipochaeta elliptica plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native environment.
